content: the lily jumper the lily crochet jumper pattern notes - this pattern is worked in one piece no sewing required there should be 8 ends to weave in at the end - after the first round use stitch markers to mark each of the 4 corners of the yoke - at each corner of the yoke is a v_stitch see abbreviations below - at the beginning of each round a double_crochet is worked as a chain 3 ch3 meaning that the first v_stitch of each round is worked as a ch4 dc1 - when counting stitches the ch3 of each round does count towards stitch count - separate the sleeves from the yoke before continuing to complete the main body this will make the pattern significantly easier guage 9x9cm = 4 row of 10 double crochets during rounds using an 8mm hook sizing this pattern is written for a size medium uk size 12/14 measurements - chest 54cm - back length 63cm - arm length 70cm to make smaller / larger decrease / increase your stitch count you will also need less / more yarn depending on sizing notions 8mm crochet hook 5 5mm crochet hook 3 5mm crochet hook 300g aran weight yarn this project used sirdar jewelspun in the shade citrine sunrise stitch markers x4 sewing needle abbreviations *this pattern is written using us terms* chain - chain single_crochet single_crochet double_crochet double_crochet slip_stitch slip_stitch v_stitch dc1 ch1 dc1 decrease decrease in this pattern this is always a double_crochet decrease fo fasten_off pattern yoke *using 8mm hook* round 1 ch76 when you reach the end being careful not to twist your chain slip_stitch to the first chain round 2 ch4 dc1 in the same chain stitch you have completed the first v_stitch *dc1 in the next 22 chain v_stitch into the next chain dc1 in the next 14 chain* v_stitch in the next chain repeat steps between ** and slip_stitch to the ch3 you created to start the round the third of the four chains which created the first v_stitch ~ after finishing the round it might be a good idea to use a stitch marker to mark each of the v stitches to help you find them next time ~ rounds 3-11 slip_stitch to ch1 space ch4 and dc2 in the same chain space first v_stitch of the round completed double_crochet around completing a v_stitch in the ch1 space of each corner every time you will be working into the v_stitch of the previous row do not fasten_off you can continue using this yarn when you continue to the main body and avoid having more ends to sew in sleeves *using 8mm hook* here you will separate the sleeves from the yoke attach your yarn at the underarm of the jumper by slip_stitch through both v_stitch spaces round 1 ch3 dc1 in every stitch around and slip_stitch to the ch3 rounds 2-21 repeat round 1 fo and sew in ends round 22 shell row ch1 *sc1 sk1 dc5
